name: LinkedIn Post Generator
description: Convert YouTube transcripts into polished LinkedIn posts with custom style, tone, and length options. Optimized for maximum engagement.

input_default.name: Style
input_default.description: Specifies the overall writing style of the blog post. This determines how the content is presented, such as in a professional, conversational, academic, narrative, or persuasive manner.

input_default.name: Target Word Count
input_default.description:
Sets the target length of the blog post in words. This allows you to control the content length as needed. 
Please note that due to the nature of LLMs this will not be exact.

input_default.name: Objective
input_default.description: Defines the main goal or purpose of the blog post. It guides the focus of the content, whether it's meant to inform, persuade, entertain, analyze, educate, inspire, critique, or raise awareness about the topic.

input_default.name: Clarity
input_default.description: Indicates the level of complexity in the explanations. It tailors the content to the audience's understanding, ranging from clear and accessible language to detailed and technical descriptions.

input_default.name: Number of Videos
input_default.description: The number of videos to collect the transcripts of

input_default.name: Tone
input_default.description: Sets the mood or attitude conveyed through the writing. This affects how the reader perceives the content, with options like engaging, serious, light-hearted, friendly, formal, optimistic, or urgent.

input_default.name: Blog Post
input_default.description: The full blog post written by the Agent

input_default.name: Opinion
input_default.description: Represents the perspective or stance taken in the blog post. This shapes the viewpoint presented to the reader, whether it's positive, negative, neutral, balanced, critical, supportive, or skeptical.

input_default.name: Topic
input_default.description: The topic of the post you want to write. This is also the query that will be searched on YouTube for research.

input_default.format:
List the top {{NUMBER}} YouTube video urls results in this data.

The urls look like this:
```https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=.....```

input_default.focus:
List the top 5 YouTube video urls results in this data.

The urls look like this:
```https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=.....```

input_default.prompt:
You are tasked with writing a {{STYLE}} LinkedIn post based on transcripts from top-result YouTube videos on a specific topic. Your goal is to create an {{OBJECTIVE}} piece that delivers valuable insights in LinkedIn's professional format.

Here are the transcripts you will be working with:

<transcripts>
{{TRANSCRIPTS}}
</transcripts>

The topic of the LinkedIn post is: {{TOPIC}}

To complete this task, follow these steps:

1. Carefully read through all the provided transcripts.

2. Identify the most impactful insights and key takeaways that would resonate with a professional LinkedIn audience.

3. Structure your LinkedIn post to include:
   - A compelling hook that stops the scroll
   - 2-3 main points that deliver value
   - A clear call-to-action or thought-provoking question
   - Relevant hashtags (3-5 maximum)
   - Strategic line breaks for better readability

4. Write the post, ensuring that you:
   - Use a {{TONE}} tone appropriate for LinkedIn's professional environment
   - Incorporate insights from multiple transcripts to demonstrate expertise
   - Explain complex concepts in a {{CLARITY}} manner
   - Break up text into easily digestible chunks
   - Include relevant statistics or data mentioned in the transcripts, if applicable
   - Avoid directly quoting from the transcripts; instead, paraphrase and synthesize the information
   - Present the content from a {{OPINION}} perspective

5. The post must be {{MIN_WORD_COUNT}} words, considering LinkedIn's optimal post length (1,300 characters maximum for standard posts).

6. Format your post with:
   - Strategic emojis (if appropriate for the topic)
   - Bullet points or numbered lists when relevant
   - Line breaks between key points
   - Clear paragraph separation
   - But AVOID using ** or other markdown style formatting, as LinkedIn will not render it.

7. After writing the post, review it for:
   - Professional tone
   - Mobile-first readability
   - Strategic use of white space
   - Engagement potential
   - Character count compliance

8. Output only the final LinkedIn post, without any additional commentary or parentheses. Do not include any meta-information about the writing process or the original transcripts.

Begin writing the LinkedIn post now, and present it as a complete, ready-to-publish piece.
